Reboot solved it (should have known...). Logging off and back on didn't. What causes this problem?

I have no idea.  Windows XP must somehow be leaking resources when a process exits.  That's the only way that this could happen.  This kind of SWT error happens when we make an operating system call and it fails (think malloc() failed).  There should be no way that rebooting fixes it ... but it does.
